annotation.TEXT: Okay, I've got five cards here, and my maximum hand size is 4, so which card should I pitch?
Wow, everyone over there is still surviving with 1 HP, including that Robo Ball enemy!
Okay, now more about the Normas... At the start of the game, everyone's first norma is getting 10 or more stars. So, once you have at least 10 stars, land on a home panel to level up.
Looks like I'm landing on green no matter where I go. I do like how the game highlights the panels that you could possibly land on while you're at a junction.
There's our KFC! Okay, now for the boss...
Okay, NOW I can finally play Present for You!
Yeah, that Out of Ammo card Yuki played prevents me from choosing the "Card" option on this turn. I'll have to wait until next turn.
Dude! I rolled a 3 exactly, so I can fight the boss without having to battle Sora first!
Yeah, let's go all out here, with this "I'm on Fire!" card I hate as well.
I'll go over normas in more detail later. For right now, I'm going to click on "Info" and examine some stuff.

So, I got this Steam game recently for $1.75 during the Monster Summer Sale, and I've been enjoying it! And, after having several fun online multiplayer matches, I decided I wanted to try recording a video of it!
He's going for stars again, so he'll need 70 this time.

Okay, I'm doing some math in my head here... If I use Rainbow-Colored Circle and try to Evade, I'd need to roll a 4 or higher. If I don't use it and Defend, I'd also need a 4 or higher to survive. Either way, it's 50-50, but with the Evade plan, I won't be hurt at all if I make it.

Oh, man. Peat slaughtered that seagull! Okay, when you defeat a random encounter, you gain 1 "Win". Wins could be used to fulfill normas at higher levels, but we're all still shooting for 10 stars right now.
However, I'm not stopping here, since I don't want to battle, and I can see that I'm going to land on a yellow panel for stars that I need.
Yay, level 4! This time, the norma choices are 120 stars, or 9 "Wins". I'll go for stars, of course.

That was a lame roll. I only gained 1 star from that panel. Bonus panels give you stars equal to the die roll times your level. (However, if you're above level 3, the game treats your level as being equal to 3 for the calculation.)

Okay, I'm 3 spaces away from a boss panel, which Sora's standing on, so if I roll more than 3, I could battle Sora just to stop there. I could also try Sealed Guardian (to try to KO Sora) or Dash! (to nearly guarantee the 3) now.
Nice revenge kill there, Sora!
Also, you can hover over the characters in the corners to see their stats. For instance, Peat here has +1 for Attack, Defense, and Evade, and has 3 HP.
Yuki's back up.
Wow, Sora has kinda been the butt monkey of this game so far.
Ooh, Sora did some decent damage to the boss and lived to tell the tale. Keep track of the boss's HP, because you might want to try for the kill when its health gets low.

That card causes the next Drop panel that Yuki lands on to also remove the same amount of stars from the player(s) with the most stars. (I don't know if it includes the one who played Flip Out, though.)
Maybe I can roll at least a 5 and take down Peat while he's still at 1 HP as well?
Everyone will draw cards until they have a full hand, and I'll gain 10 stars per card drawn. You want to play this when more than 3 cards will be drawn, so that you gain more stars than you pay.
Alright, so I've loaded up my file, and I'm doing Free Play mode here. This is where you can play online matches, but I'm just going to do a single player game for this video.
Oh, geez.

The red panels will remain boss panels until someone destroys the boss. Also, the boss will only show up once per game in this way. (However, it's possible for someone to play a card that forces an extra boss appearance.)
BTW, if you want to more closely see the last two cards that were played, you can hover your cursor over the cards shown just above the lower-right character.

Next, I'll mention the cards. Once during your turn, before you move, you can play a card from your hand if the conditions are right for it. However, I can't play this card now, since I don't have the needed levels or stars to play it.
Also, you should always pick Evade if the opponent attacks for 1, since at worst, you'll just take the same 1 damage that you'd definitely take if you picked Defend.

In this game, the normal maximum hand size is 3 (although for Aru, it's actually 4). If you're holding more cards than that at the end of your turn, you'll have to discard until you're down to 3 (or 4 for Aru).
Ohh... Nuts. I obviously don't want to drop stars, but I really don't want to tangle with the boss either.
Well, at least that was a good time to roll a 1, so I only lost 5 stars.

Bah. I'm either gonna land on a home panel or a warp panel, and neither of them will grant me more stars. BTW, everyone gains stars at the start of each turn. This bonus starts off at 1 star per turn, but does eventually increase as the game goes on.
I guess Yuki took her anger out on a seagull.
With Aru, I usually like to go for stars, since she's not likely to get many KOs with her weak ATK stat.
Sora achieved level 3, and chose to go for "Wins" again. She'll need 5 "Wins" this time.
Nuts. Only a 3, and I've got this ugly choice again. The boss still has too much HP for me to have a chance at killing him, so I'll just drop some stars.
Okay, now as for that card I just drew, I can play it now, since it's a level 1 card and requires only 3 stars.
Oh, geez. What unholy power did I just draw?
Pfft... That card just moved my Trap card onto a random panel. It's the only trap on the board right now, so I still know that it's definitely my Bad Pudding card.
Ah, Sora successfully revived that time. Next turn, she can move normally. (Unless someone KOs her again before her next turn comes around, but I doubt that'll happen.)
Bah. I lost 4x4=16 stars there. Well, it's probably better than engaging the boss and possibly losing half of my stars to him and being put out of commission for a while.
Umm, Peat? Here's a tip: Don't roll 1's while fighting a boss. It's bad for your health.
Landing on a purple panel warps you to another purple panel at random. And, landing on a red panel puts you into a battle with a random 3HP enemy.
So, it's basically a board game. You roll a d6, move that many spaces, and do stuff depending on where you land.
Alright, at least I revived right away. Now, I might consider using Sealed Guardian to try to get revenge on Sora...
Oh, yeah. There's this card that I just drew, which sets everyone's HP to 1. However, it's a level 5 card that costs a whopping 50 stars! Unholy power doesn't come cheap!
Alright, let's see now... Do I want to "Dash!"? Perhaps, since I'm 6 spaces away from my own home panel, and I can choose to stop at it if I roll more than 6.
Nope, I'm not even close to 200 stars yet.
Peat just played a Battle card that increased his EVD, which guaranteed his ability to evade Sora's low roll there. (That Battle card might've come from my 10-card deck.)
Hello, and welcome to something completely different! It's 100% Orange Juice!
Oh, I do have a card that can be used in battle this time. This one increases my ATK by 1, at the cost of 1 DEF.
Hmm... Yuki has just 1 HP. If I roll at least a 5, I could try to KO her.
Umm... Nah. I'm still not going to fight you while you're at full health. (Actually, maybe I should've tried the Sealed Guardian plan there. Oh, well.)
Alright, I'm four spaces away from Yuki. Maybe I could try to Forced Revival her and then KO her.
This card requires me to be at least level 2, and it'll cost me 30 stars to play it. (In the card's cost, green stars count as 1, and yellow stars count as 10.)
Alright, let's move!
Just showing off the last two cards used there. Alright, time to eat my cookie. OMNOMNOM!
She gained 5x3x2=30 stars from that one.
However, Sora does want to battle me. Now, there are some cards that can be used during battle, but not this one (even if I had the needed stars and levels).
Sora just played this game's equivalent of Bill / Pot of Greed / Divination.
Peat utterly destroyed that seagull.
Nuts. Only rolled a 4. Okay, so do I want to draw a card, or do I want more stars?
So, the goal in this game is to complete objectives (called normas) to increase your level. Completing your norma after you've reached level 5 will win you the game.
Pfft... And of course I roll a 6... Well, I'm not going to challenge Sora now.
Sora got smacked there, but barely survived. And, thanks to the home panel, she instantly healed 1 HP and leveled up. Now everyone's at level 2.
For this game, I'll just go with Practice Field and put in one field event. I'll mention what field events do later.
Nuts. I can either warp, or land on my home panel. Well, it's not as bad a choice as Drop or Boss.
Man, neither of us can hit each other, which I guess is fine by me.

Okay, now as you just saw, Sora tried to revive there, but failed. When you're KO'd, you can try to revive on the following turns, and if you roll the necessary number, you'll revive with full HP, and can move normally next turn.
Except, she just moved 6 spaces away from me, and it's unlikely I'd roll a 6 to catch up to her.
Oh, man. Peat set a trap of his own. I have no idea what it might be.
You'll still gain stars even if you don't win, so even if a game is going south for you, you might want to stick around until the end anyway. (You don't get any stars if you quit a game early.)
Alright, let's do the Forced Revival thing! It costs 30 stars, but I stand a good chance of taking 70 stars from Yuki here!
This also revived Peat as well, since it targets everyone, but I'm not concerned about him.
Alright, there's the boss, who's called Store Manager. He's got +3 ATK, +2 DEF, -1 EVD, and a monstrous 8 HP.

LOL. Peat just played a card that did 1 damage to Yuki, KO-ing her. However, KO-ing someone outside of battle like that won't award you "Wins" or steal their stars (unless the card you used says otherwise).
When you encounter certain junctions while moving, you can choose where you want to go. Of course, I'm going to land on a yellow Bonus panel either way here.
No, the boss survived, and he's now at 1 HP! This is the time to try to kill him!
It's Warp or Home again. Or, I could engage one of them in battle to stop on the Bonus panel.

I wonder what would happen if everybody brought a deck containing only Trap cards, and all of them are set on a map that's large enough to hold them all, and the 8 Hypers are in everyone's hands, and then someone lands on a green panel while the deck is empty...
But, I don't know... Umm... This is probably a big mistake, but I'm going to play Super All-Out Mode.
D'oh! He managed to evade my counterattack. Oh, well.
Wow, they just won't go down!
If the defender picks Defend, then his/her die roll is added to the DEF stat. And then, ATK - DEF = Damage dealt. However, the damage dealt will always be at least 1.

As a bonus, I landed on a home panel as well, and I have enough stars to reach level 5! Now, the final norma I need to win the game is either 200 stars or 14 "Wins", and of course, I'm going with stars!
You can easily tell which panels have Trap cards on them, but you can't see what Trap card it is until it's sprung.
On the other hand, Aru (who I'm using) has -1 Attack and Defense, but +2 Evade and 5 HP. These stats affect die rolls in combat.
Ooh, Holy Night's a good card, which increases the per-turn bonus stars by 1. And, it's a level 1 card with no cost. I'll definitely want to play it next turn.
Hmm... I don't need a cookie right now... Forced Revival might be good if I can get close to Yuki while she's still KO'd, so that I can clobber her again and take half of her stars.

When you pass by your own home panel while moving, you can choose to stop at it. In addition, whenever you pass by another character, you can choose to battle him/her. If you do, you stop moving right there.
You've triggered my Trap card! Wow, I didn't expect my trap to be set off so quickly. That caused Yuki to discard a random card, which will allow me to get more stars from Present for You!
Nice. I spent 30 stars, then a total of 6 cards were drawn, and I gained 60 stars back. I'm just 1 star away from my next norma now!

Okay, the traps have been rearranged again. One of them is my Assault trap, which will force the one who lands on it to battle with me. (Note: If I land on my own Assault trap, it will fail and be discarded without doing anything.)
Okay, when you click on "Info", you can hover your cursor over the center deck to see things like what turn (chapter) it is, and what the field effects are.
Darn you, Yuki! She just played a card that prevents anyone from playing cards for a whole turn, so I can't play Present for You right now!
YESSSS!!! My roll of 6 ensured my victory!
So, in battle, the attacker rolls a d6, and that value is added to the attacker's ATK stat. Then, the defender can choose to either Defend or Evade.
It's only a 1 HP recovery, but it's a level 1 card with no cost, so it's nice to have.
Man, she rolled really high for her attack, but so did the boss on defense, so the boss survived. He's down to 2 HP, and possibly within my kill range.

If the defender chooses Evade, then the die roll is added to the EVD stat. Then, if EVA > ATK, then the defender avoids damage completely. But if EVA <= ATK, then the defender takes the attacker's full attack value in damage!
It's gonna be tough to recover from this loss. Maybe I could get lucky and kill the boss. (Hey, that rhymes!)
(But, unlike Bonus panels, Drop panels will properly treat your level as 4 or 5 if you're at level 4 or 5, which kinda stinks.)

Well, I hope you all enjoyed watching this gameplay video of 100% Orange Juice! (Unfortunately, due to Nintendo suddenly becoming jerkish, this is likely the last video over 15 minutes that I'll be uploading for a long time...)
Nice. I rolled a 10, but I can stop at my home.
Pfft... And then I roll a 1, which only gives me 3 stars, not 5, because as I said earlier, for some reason, the Bonus panels treat your level as 3 if you're higher than that.
When the game is over, you'll be awarded stars based on your performance during the game, which can be used for buying stuff like booster packs, maps, and additional characters in the shop.
NOOOOO!!! I only rolled a 3...
Oh, but if I keep going, I'll land on another home panel, and you can heal and level up on any home panel. So, I think I'll actually do that instead of stopping at my home.
I thought someone was gonna get KO'd there, but they both survived with 1 HP. This would be a good time to try to finish either of them off.
LOL! Okay, the card Yuki just played KOs a unit at random. And yes, it can cause Yuki to KO herself, as you just saw.
Ah, now that is a card that I am able to play, when my next turn rolls around.
Huh, Sora chose to go for "Wins" for her next norma. At level 2, your norma choices are either get at least 30 stars, or get at least 2 "Wins".
Okay, Yuki now has 13 stars, so she can level up by stopping at a home panel now. But, until she does, she's still level 1.
Okay, it's my turn. Now, the CPU that just moved landed on a yellow panel, which grants you bonus stars depending on your level and the die roll.

Hmm... If I challenged Peat to battle and defeated him, I'd steal half of his stars and immediately level up from this home panel. However, with his +1 DEF and my -1 ATK, I'd have to get ultra lucky to KO him (like me rolling a 6 and him rolling a 1).
So, that "I'm on Fire!" card came from someone else's 10-card deck here. (BTW, Aru's Hyper is Present for You, which you just saw me play.)
And, since Sora stopped to battle me, she gets to partake in the bonus panel that I'm standing on.
Yeah, level up! Now, when you level up, you get to choose whether to go for "Stars" or "Wins" for your next norma. Choose carefully, since you can't change your mind later.
This time, I'll pick Evade.
That Trap card reduces Yuki's DEF by 2 for the next three turns. She could be easily KO-able now.

Nuts. I landed on a home panel without first completing my norma. Okay, so landing on a home panel heals you for 1 HP if you're not at full. And, if you've fulfilled your norma condition, you level up.
Here's where you assemble your 10-card deck for the game, but I already have a deck saved, so I'll just load that and get right to the game!
Oh, man. She's guaranteed to roll a 6 thanks to her Hyper, so I know her attack value will be 7.
Ooh, nice. Now, I could decide to play "Dash!" next turn, and I'd still be able to level up if I land on a home panel.
Oh, maybe I can take out Peat right here!
Sealed Guardian is legal to play now, but it would not help me at all at this time.

Alright, it's boss time! After a player hits level 4, a boss will show up at the beginning of the next turn, and all red enemy panels will become boss panels. Land on a boss panel, and you'll face something mean and nasty!
Uh, oh. This could be bad for me.
The CPU opponents are turn order and randomly decided, and it looks like I'm player 2 for this game.
Hmm... It won't be much of a gain, but I'll still reap a 10-star profit from this Present for You, since 4 cards will be drawn.
Gamble is Yuki's Hyper, BTW, and it has a cost of 13. (Superstitious, much?)

There are other field effects that are possible as well, which can do things warp everyone around, injure everyone, or give every player a card every 5th turn. Speaking of cards, landing on a green panel lets you draw 1 card.
Nuts. I'm at the necessary level to play this card, but I don't have 30 stars yet. I'd like to play it soon, because it can give me lots of stars.
That boss kill gave me 88 stars (the 78 he stole, plus I guess the 10 he was worth to begin with), and put me above 200! I might be able to win next turn!
Hmm... I think I'll take my chances without using either card. Sealed Guardian is dangerous, and I may want to have Dash! available later.
There's another Trap card. Maybe I'll set it next turn.
Umm... I don't know why I chose to draw a card there. Looking back now, going for stars would've clearly been the better option, because of the "Present for You" card I'm holding.
Ouch. Sora just lost all of her stars.
I still can't play "Present for You" yet... Playing it would cause everybody to draw up to their maximum hand size, and give me 10 stars per card drawn in this way.
I need 6 more stars to complete the norma.

If you fail to revive, then on the next turn, the required number to roll will decrease by 1. If that number drops to 2 and you fail again, you'll automatically revive on the next turn without needing to roll. (Also, having that happen to you gets you an achievement.)
Oh, man. Yuki chose Trap+Boss there. First, the trap, which gives a random regular enemy the first strike against Yuki.
And finally, Sora down here has +1 ATK, 0 DEF, +1 EVA, and 4 HP.
The card Yuki just played doubles the value of the next Bonus panel she lands on.
Assault isn't really a very good trap for Aru, but I'll play it just to get it out of my hand and improve Present for You's effect.
Ohh, Peat just got wrecked due to a lousy Defense roll! Yuki's really racking up the "Wins"! And stars as well!
I'm thinking if I want to battle either Peat or Sora. I only have to fight one of them to stop my movement. Hmm... They both have +1 ATK, so it probably doesn't really matter which one I fight.

Okay, I guess I'll set my Trap card now. The next person to land on this space will trigger the trap and be subject to its effect, including me, if I happen to be the next one to land here. So, yeah. Watch out, as you can trigger your own traps.

Okay, so Peat lost 29 stars to the boss. Also, Yuki failed to revive again! Ooh, I'm only 2 spaces away from her, and I've still got my +2 ATK effect! This looks like the perfect time for Forced Revival!
Alright, Peat's now level 2. Looks like he chose the "Stars" norma. You can tell because "Stars" is highlighted in yellow on his stats in the lower-right corner.
I have 31 stars, so of course I'll stop at home and level up! I'll choose "Stars" again, and this time, the requirement is 70.
Hmm... I could play Present for You now, but I think I should play Holy Night first, so that I have room to draw an additional card (and gain 10 more stars) when I do play Present for You.
Ooh, a cookie. I can definitely use that, since I'm hurt right now.
KFC, anyone? ...Or not, since the chicken evaded Peat's attack. If you're at 1HP, you may as well try to evade, since picking Defend guarantees that you'll take at least 1 damage.
Oh, I just drew a trap card. I'll mention how those work later.
Hmm... I'd rather fight a random enemy than drop stars.
However, playing it now would drop me below 10 stars, and I kinda want to level up. Plus, I don't see a real need to move extra far right now, so I'll save it for later.
Okay, now the choices are Home or Trap+Warp. I'd rather not trip a trap, so I'll land on Home this time.
Demo count: 1
Sora didn't complete her norma either, but stopping at that home point did heal her missing 1 HP.
And with that, Sora stole 83 stars from me, and got enough "Wins" to level up. She chose "Wins" again, so she'll need 9 of those.
Very good. My evasion would've only failed there if I rolled a 1, and I still would've survived anyway.
Oh, geez. That's a high attack roll. Aru's certainly better at evading than defending, but if the evasion fails, I'll take the full 6 damage and be KO'd. I'm going to try to Defend.

I didn't even include "I'm on Fire!" in my deck. However, the whole deck used for the game is comprised of 48 cards: Each player's 10-card deck, along with 8 special cards that become a character's unique "Hyper" when drawn by that player.
Okay, I have the stars I need. If my next roll is a 1 or a 5, I win!
Alright, I drew another Present for You. BTW, there is no "decking out" in this game. If all 48 cards are drawn, then the discarded cards are shuffled together to make a new deck.
That's a guaranteed successful evade.
Here we go!
Sometimes, when you encounter an enemy, you might end up facing one that had been previously damaged earlier in the game, so you may only need 1 or 2 damage to destroy it in such a case.

Now, I could use Sealed Guardian and try to KO either Sora and/or Peat, but even if I KO them both, they don't have enough stars for me to profit off of it, and I'd be at risk of getting KO-ed myself.
They all could have their uses, but I think the traps here are the least useful, so I'll discard... uhh... Mimyuu's Hammer.
I guess I'll set this trap.
Sora just played her Hyper, which guarantees that she rolls a 6 for all of her die rolls this turn.
Yuki got wrecked, and lost 49 stars to the boss (I guess losses are rounded down). So, the boss has claimed two victims and stolen 78 stars so far.
Ah, the per-turn star bonus has gone up to 2 now, giving me a total of 10 stars. If I land on a home panel now, I can level up.
Okay, let's see... Yuki over here has +2 ATK, -1 DEF, -1 EVD, and 5 HP.
Oh, also, you can hover over the characters in the corners without first clicking "Info".
Yeah, Yuki just destroyed Sora there. When you KO another player in battle, you're awarded 2 "Wins". In addition, you steal half of the KO'd player's stars.
I guess I could use Present for You again, which'll give me another 10-star profit.
Whoa, someone finally got KO'd over there! Took long enough! Oh, and with that, Peat reaches level 3.
Super All-Out Mode gives everyone +2 ATK in their next battle, but I don't know if I want to play that. Doesn't seem worth the 30 stars.
Another trap has been placed.
So, yeah. I decided against trying to fight him.
Uh, oh. Will Sora kill the boss? If she does, I'm so using Sealed Guardian next turn!
Heh, Sora landed on a blue Drop panel and lost her stars. They're basically the reverse of yellow Bonus panels, costing you stars equal to the die roll x your level.
Uh, oh. Yuki just played a card that summoned another boss. This could get interesting...
She played that evasion boosting card, but it wasn't enough! I managed to take her down!
Hmm... Well, if I had chosen Evade, I would've succeeded with that roll, but this is only 2 damage. I can probably recover.
HUZZAH!!! That was the best time to roll a 1! And that's game!
Sweet! Present for you drew a total of 7 cards that time, so I got a net gain of 40 stars from it! And just like that, I've hit my next norma!
For most characters, the starting number for revivals is 5, but it starts at 4 or 6 for certain characters.
Well, that sucked. The ATK boost went to waste, and I took major damage in return. I kinda hate the "I'm on Fire!" card, because it usually backfires on me like that.
Oh, geez!

Speaking of leveling up, Yuki just did. She's level 2 now. Also, you may have noticed that I recovered 1 HP at the start of this turn. With the "Regeneration" field effect, everyone heals 1 HP at the start of every fifth turn.
Okay, good. I just wanted to avoid damage. I don't care that I missed him as well.

Okay, just like before, I could stop at my home, or travel the remaining 4 spaces and land on the next home panel. But, since there's a trap on the next home panel that could screw me up, I'm going to stop at my home this time.
